intro: Hedyosmum domingense var. cubense, commonly known as Cuban hedyosmum, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
